--- # TITLE & AUTHOR title: "Diss" subtitle: "Current Status" author: "Joschka Schwarz" institute: "Hamburg University of Technology" date: today date-format: "dddd, D[th] [of] MMMM YYYY" section-divs: true --- ## Table of Contents {data-state="hide-menubar"}
      # Topics {data-stack-name="Topics"} ## Possible Overarching Topics * Bricolage and effectuation * Technical Entrepreneur (prior knowledge) * Contingency * Novelty and Technological uncertainty * Knowledge spillover We are interested in how actors are influenced by and interact with their social and cultural environments to bring about novelty, e.g. with regard to ideas, teams, products or business practices. # Data sources {data-stack-name="Intro"} ## Research Scope ```{=html}

       

      W-11 Research Focus & Fields

      We are interested in how actors are influenced by and interact with their social and cultural environments to bring about novelty, e.g. with regard to ideas, teams, products or business practices.

      ``` # Data sources {data-stack-name="Data"} ## Step1: Identity matching Linking Developer with startup data ::: {.absolute top=30% left=10% width=80%} ![](img/data_sources_v2.svg) ::: ## GitHub Use GitHub Api to gather information about user ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="|1|2"} httr::GET("https://api.github.com/users/jwarz") httr::GET("https://api.github.com/user/40362019") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> Rows: 1 #> Columns: 28 #> $ login "jwarz" #> $ id 40362019 #> $ node_id "MDQ6VXNlcjQwMzYyMDE5" #> $ avatar_url "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/40362019?… #> $ gravatar_id "" #> $ url "https://api.github.com/users/jwarz" #> $ html_url "https://github.com/jwarz" #> $ followers_url "https://api.github.com/users/jwarz/followers" #> $ following_url "https://api.github.com/users/jwarz/following{/oth… #> $ gists_url "https://api.github.com/users/jwarz/gists{/gist_id… #> $ starred_url "https://api.github.com/users/jwarz/starred{/owner… #> $ subscriptions_url "https://api.github.com/users/jwarz/subscriptions" #> $ organizations_url "https://api.github.com/users/jwarz/orgs" #> $ repos_url "https://api.github.com/users/jwarz/repos" #> $ events_url "https://api.github.com/users/jwarz/events{/privac… #> $ received_events_url "https://api.github.com/users/jwarz/received_event… #> $ type "User" #> $ site_admin FALSE #> $ name "Joschka Schwarz" #> $ company "Hamburg University of Technology - TUHH Institute… #> $ blog "" #> $ location "Hamburg" #> $ public_repos 16 #> $ public_gists 5 #> $ followers 2 #> $ following 1 #> $ created_at "2018-06-18T14:30:11Z" #> $ updated_at "2023-04-05T09:00:16Z" ``` ::: ::: ## GitHub Get all GitHub User profiles via API (iterated > 42 mil user ids) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} open_dataset("gh_api_users_wrangled.parquet") |> glimpse() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> FileSystemDataset with 1 Parquet file #> 42,557,276 rows x 16 columns #> $ id 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, 22… #> $ login "mojombo", "defunkt", "pjhyett", "wycats", … #> $ type > User, User, User, User, User, User, User, U… #> $ site_admin > FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FA… #> $ name "Tom Preston-Werner", "Chris Wanstrath", "P… #> $ company NA, "@github ", "GitHub, Inc.", "Tilde, Inc… #> $ blog "http://tom.preston-werner.com", "http://ch… #> $ location "San Francisco", "San Francisco", "San Fran… #> $ email "tom@mojombo.com", "chris@github.com", "pj@… #> $ email_hash "25c7c18223fb42a4c6ae1c8db6f50f9b", "74858b… #> $ bio NA, "🍔 ", NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, "Co-… #> $ public_repos 60, 107, 8, 207, 22, 86, 137, 45, 97, 163, … #> $ public_gists 62, 273, 21, 749, 106, 79, 440, 47, 95, 66,… #> $ followers 21141, 20355, 8204, 8963, 475, 81, 1145, 70… #> $ following 11, 210, 30, 4, 13, 2, 6, 14, 16, 27, 4, 17… #> $ created_at 2007-10-20 05:24:19, 2007-10-20 05:24:19, 2… #> Call `print()` for full schema details ``` ::: ::: ## Stackoverflow ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Dump 2021 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} open_dataset("so_dump_2021_09_users.parquet") |> glimpse() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> FileSystemDataset with 1 Parquet file #> 15,538,940 rows x 13 columns #> $ Id 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13, 16, 17… #> $ Reputation 61327, 5870, 15446, 32650, 50496, 1787,… #> $ CreationDate 2008-07-31 14:22:31, 2008-07-31 14:22:3… #> $ DisplayName "Jeff Atwood", "Geoff Dalgas", "Jarrod … #> $ LastAccessDate 2021-09-04 20:43:20, 2021-09-02 00:42:1… #> $ AboutMe "

      $ Views 587263, 29947, 28149, 81786, 14011, 825… #> $ UpVotes 3390, 670, 7912, 855, 789, 12, 47, 0, 0… #> $ DownVotes 1311, 88, 100, 100, 34, 9, 4, 0, 0, 210… #> $ WebsiteUrl "https://blog.codinghorror.com/", "http… #> $ Location "El Cerrito, CA", "Corvallis, OR", "Joh… #> $ AccountId 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 561854, 9, 11, … #> $ ProfileImageUrl NA, "https://i.stack.imgur.com/nDllk.pn… ``` ::: ::: ### Example 2021 :::: {.r-stack} ::: {.fragment .fade-out fragment-index=1} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} open_dataset("so_dump_2021_09_users.parquet") |> filter(DisplayName == "Christoph Ihl") glimpse() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> FileSystemDataset with 1 Parquet file (query) #> 1 rows x 13 columns #> $ Id 9882371 #> $ Reputation 1 #> $ CreationDate 2018-06-01 16:34:46 #> $ DisplayName "Christoph Ihl" #> $ LastAccessDate 2021-02-07 13:16:43 #> $ AboutMe NA #> $ Views 28 #> $ UpVotes 0 #> $ DownVotes 0 #> $ WebsiteUrl "https://startupengineer.io" #> $ Location "Hamburg, Germany" #> $ AccountId 13695600 #> $ ProfileImageUrl "https://graph.facebook.com/92094940142… #> Call `print()` for query details ``` ::: ::: ::: ::::: {.fragment .fade-in fragment-index=1} :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Stackoverflow knitr::include_graphics( "https://graph.facebook.com/920949401423102/picture?type=large" ) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](img/christoph.jpeg){width=50%} ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # GitHub knitr::include_graphics( "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/8004978?v=4" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/8004978?v=4){width=50%} ::: ::: ::: :::: ::::: :::: ### Dump 2013 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} open_dataset("so_dump_2013_09_users.parquet") |> glimpse() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> FileSystemDataset with 1 Parquet file #> 2,332,402 rows x 13 columns #> $ Id 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13, 16, 17… #> $ Reputation 27314, 1772, 7645, 20560, 25459, 943, 6… #> $ CreationDate 2008-07-31 14:22:31, 2008-07-31 14:22:3… #> $ DisplayName "Jeff Atwood", "Geoff Dalgas", "Jarrod … #> $ LastAccessDate 2013-09-03 04:16:21, 2013-09-06 04:53:1… #> $ AboutMe "

      $ Views 119303, 13331, 15913, 50749, 5997, 2902… #> $ UpVotes 3177, 531, 4595, 730, 757, 12, 35, 0, 0… #> $ DownVotes 1297, 86, 82, 92, 34, 9, 4, 0, 0, 144, … #> $ WebsiteUrl "http://www.codinghorror.com/blog/", "h… #> $ Location "El Cerrito, CA", "Corvallis, OR", "New… #> $ Age 43, 36, 34, NA, 43, NA, 42, 34, NA, 33,… #> $ EmailHash "51d623f33f8b83095db84ff35e15dbe8", "b4… #> Call `print()` for full schema details ``` ::: ::: ::: ## Stackoverflow ::: {.absolute top="10%" left="0" width="100%" height="100%"} ::: {style="text-align: center"} ![](img/stackoverflow_user.png) ::: ::: ::: {.fragment .fade-up} ::: {.absolute top="2em" left="42%"}        ![](img/arrow-2.svg) ::: ::: ::: {.fragment .fade-up} ::: {.absolute top="6em" left="28%"}        ![](img/arrow-1.svg) ::: ::: . . . ::: {.absolute top="50%" left="10%"} ::: {style="color: #cc0000"} code *can* go here ::: ::: # Test {data-name="test"} ## Heading ```{=html} Fade in > Turn red > Fade out ``` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} knitr::include_graphics("https://graph.facebook.com/920949401423102/picture?type=large") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](https://graph.facebook.com/920949401423102/picture?type=large) ::: ::: . . . - `revealjs` for Quarto is a framework for turning Pandoc-friendly markdown + code into beautiful slides - User guide: . . . ![](https://c.tenor.com/3EYd9ID79vcAAAAd/mic-drop-the-voice.gif){fig-align="center"} # Slide 1 {data-name="Regular slide"} A paragraph with some text and a [link](http://hakim.se). # Vertical slide 1 {data-stack-name="Vertical"} ## Vertical slide 2 # Global options {data-stack-name="Options"} The options below have user configurable options. In a regular Reveal.js presentation, these can be set through JavaScript, but Quarto makes it configurable through YAML options. ::: columns ::: {.column style="font-size: 2rem"} 1. menubarclass 2. menuclass 3. activeclass 4. activeelement ::: ::: {.column style="font-size: 2rem"} 5. barhtml 7. flat 8. scale ::: ::: ## Option 1: menubarclass The menubarclass option sets the classname of menubars. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: menubarclass: "menubar" ```

      Simplemenu will show the menubar(s) on all pages. If you do not want to show the menubar on certain pages, use data-state="hide-menubar" on that section. This behaviour also works when exporting to PDF using the Reveal.js ?print-pdf option.

      ## Option 2: menuclass The menuclass option sets the classname of the menu. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: menuclass: "menu" ``` Simplemenu looks inside this menu for list items (LI's). ## Option 3: activeclass The activeclass option is the class an active menuitem gets. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: activeclass: "active" ``` ## Option 4: activeelement The activeelement option sets the item that gets the active class. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: activeelement: "li" ``` You may want to change it to the anchor inside the li, like this: `activeelement: "a"`. ## Option 5: barhtml You can add the HTML for the header (and/or footer) through this option. This way you no longer need to edit the template. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: barhtml: header: "
        " footer: "" ``` ## Option 5: barhtml (Continued) You can also move the slide number or the controls to your header or footer. If they are nested there manually, or through the `barhtml` option, they will then display inside that header or footer. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: barhtml: header: "" footer: "
          " ``` ## Option 6: flat Sometimes you’ll want to limit your presentation to horizontal slides only. To still use ‘chapters’, you can use the `flat` option. By default, it is set to `false`, but you can set it to `true`. Then, when a data-name is set for a slide, any following slides will keep that menu name. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: flat: true ``` To stop inheriting the previous slide menu name, start a new named section, or add `data-sm="false"` to your slide. ## Option 7: scale When you have a lot of subjects/chapters in your menubar, they might not all fit in a row. You can then tweak the scale in the options. Simplemenu copies the Reveal.js (slide) scaling and adds a `scale` option on top of that. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: scale: 0.67 ``` It is set to be two-thirds of the main scaling. # More demos {data-name="More demos"} For more demos go to the [Simplemenu plugin](https://github.com/Martinomagnifico/reveal.js-simplemenu) for Reveal.js. Not all of the options in the regular plugin are available in the Quarto plugin.

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
